alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 10:50AM EDT until September 30 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR BERKELEY, CHARLESTON AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 1046 AM EDT, Media reported rain bands from Hurricane Ian producing heavy rain across the warned area. Several roads are now closed in Summerville. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Hurricane Ian producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Media reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, I-26/I-526 Interchange, West Ashley, Daniel Island, Crowfield Plantation, College Park, Charleston Airport, Sangaree, Magnolia Gardens, Knightsville, Lincolnville, Charleston Southern University, Otranto, Northwoods Mall and Driggerstown. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
